div.span: School Closings

strong.text-node: As a result of the COVID-19 pandemic, Governor Wolf has ordered all Pennsylvania schools to remain
closed for the rest of the 2019-2020 academic year.
For additional details about the Governor's order, click
. Continue to check our NCASD website for more information as it becomes available.

Continuity of Education Plan 2020
Act 13 of 2020 requires public school entities to submit a
to the Pennsylvania Department of Education no later than April 17, 2020. Click
to view NCASD's Continuity of Education Plan.
Virtual Board Meeting Information
The New Castle Area School District will hold a virtual public board meeting on
Instructions for participation will be posted
, so please check back for additional details. Thank you!
Coronavirus (COVID-19) Updates
As a result of
Governor Tom Wolf's order for all schools in Pennsylvania to close
due to concerns regarding the spread of the Coronavirus (COVID-19),
all NCASD schools will be closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 academic year.
We will be providing updates via our district website, as well as our Alert Now phone messaging system, as more information becomes available.

strong.span: All District-related coronavirus updates will be posted below.
For additional current and accurate information about the Coronavirus (COVID-19), including useful
(curated by NCASD Guidance Counselors) resources for students related to Coping With Stress and Anxiety
Thank you again for your continued patience and cooperation as we navigate this situation.

h3.span: April 16th Update - Distribution of NC Teddy Bears

span.div: On Monday April 20, 2020, the New Castle Police Department will be handing out NC Bears. They will be following the breakfast and lunch schedules. Come get your breakfast and lunch and pick up your NC Teddy Bear. Put it on display so families around the city can participate in a bear scavenger hunt. For additional information about this special event, click the MORE+ link below.

h3.span: April 13th Update - Senior End-of-Year Activities & Personal Items in Lockers

div.span: Click HERE for an updated message from Mrs. DeBlasio regarding Senior end-of-year activities and retrieval of personal belongings from lockers.

h3.span: April 3rd Update #1 - Letter to Parents About Virtual Learning

div.span: Please click HERE to read the letter from Mrs. DeBlasio regarding the District's Virtual Learning.

h3.span: April 3rd Update #2 - Virtual Learning Guide for Parents

div.span: Please click HERE to access a guide for parents regarding Virtual Learning, as well as Frequently Asked Questions.

h3.span: March 30th Update - Food Distribution Times & Locations

p.span: Effective Monday, March 30th, we have updated our times and locations in order to distribute food to more of our children.

strong.span: STARTING THE WEEK OF APRIL 20TH AND MOVING FORWARD

p.span: , we will deliver 2 breakfasts and 2 lunches every Monday and 3 breakfasts and 3 lunches every Wednesday. There will be no deliveries or pick-ups of breakfasts or lunches on Tuesday, Thursday, or Friday. This does NOT impact the dinner program. If your child is part of the backpack program, please let one of our staff members know on Wednesday deliveries. Furthermore, per a new USDA waiver, students need not be present to receive a meal; a parent/guardian can pick up a meal for every child in their home. Click
MORE + below to view times and locations, which have not changed since the March 30th update. Thank you!

h3.span: March 29th Update - Letter from Mrs. DeBlasio Regarding Additional Food Service Sites

div.span: Please click HERE to read Mrs. DeBlasio's recent letter to parents/guardians regarding additional food service sites that will be offered starting Monday, March 30th. You can find an updated and current list of all New Castle Area School District food distribution locations and times HERE.

div.span: Safe2Say Something

span.div: New Castle Junior/Senior High School is pleased to announce its implementation of Safe2Say Something. Safe2Say Something is a new tip line mandated by the state of Pennsylvania that allows students to report at-risk behaviors, warning signs, etc. anonymously.
Please click HERE for general information regarding Safe2Say Something.
Please click HERE to view the parent brochure.
